reviews.review:
Valve как всегда на высоте!
Играть в неё однозначно стоит, жаль она немного коротковата.
Прошел её за примерно за 9 часов.

Portal and Portal 2, played both, though I admit playing portal was'nt even close to the sequel. The reason, Portal 2 came out as a more refined version and including the online test chambers this package was worth every penny and dime (Indian Rupee for me).

I ususally like playing games that are eerie like RTCW was probably the only game in the FPS cadre that I truly and wholeheartedly admired.

Then came the HL2 package with Portal and I thought Portal was just a bonus game for promoting the HL2 series. I was'nt completely wrong. But it did hook on to me, like a splinter and I made the most difficult decision for my gaming side of brain, I got Portal 2.

But getting the game did'nt come easy and it had violence and pain as I broke my lovely Senheisser earplugs and dented my computer while I was watching the gameplay online and fell asleep and dropped my computer on the floor.

Now I have finished the Singleplayer game, I feel the need to write this review in praise of this game, hoping I could justify it's need in the gaming industry.

There are certain things about the game that I would like to change, but that's a different story and this review should not take that burden.

Do I recommend this game? Most certainly!

Enjoyed the game. The puzzles are pretty easy. I've got stuck 1 time and checked a youtube walkthrough to get through it. The game ran ultra smooth on my GTX 770 @ 1080 144hz. Will play again in the future and check out the user made levels and mods.
Good game, give it a try
Су** Гладос...

[h1]Best. Mindfuck. Ever.[/h1]
Despite getting screwed over multiple times by some of the multiplayer puzzles, I found this game to be extremely enjoyable regardless. I found that if you do get stuck, it is probably best to either come back in a couple of hours after doing something else for a while, or to restart the puzzle which will give you a fresh look on the puzzle as a whole.

Also, Stephen Merchant was an incredible choice to voice Wheatley, his voice suited him throughout the entire game.

Gameplay: 8.5/10 Fun concepts and challenging puzzles (especially in the late game/co-op campaign!)
Writing/Story: 10/10 You are guaranteed to laugh at the writing over and over again.
Replayability: 9/10 The singleplayer and coop gets old after a while, but there's always the Steam Workshop ready with community made maps!

Overall 9/10 - A must have for any fan of the original. Even if you don't like FPS/Puzzle games that much, it's still a great experience story-wise.

An amazingly plot-thick physics puzzle game. utilize technology of the futuristic Aperture Laboratories, a massive facility entirely based on one goal: science. your "weapon" of choice is the Aperture Mobile Portal Gun, which can place on portal-able (white) panels: portals! go in one, come out the other, and vice versa to complete your goal, whether taking advantage of momentum to make an immense jump or simply getting from point A to point B. Four (or three if you want to get technical) characters that you will meet are as follows: 

-GlaDOS

-Wheatley

-Cave Johnson

-Caroline

Not to mention: you! Chell, a human female often accused of being parent-lacking and apparently fat.

Funny, compelling, a bit eerie at times, and deep in terms of design, this game's sure to please. unless you hate creativity.

Even better than the first one!

10/10 best song ever
Good game!

I wake up, meet a British robotic sphere, GTFO, get a gun that makes holes, meet up with an old enemy, test, test, test, defeat the bad guy, replace her with the British robot, watch her get turned into a potato, get betrayed by the British robot, fall down a big a## hole, hear the owner rant about science, discover gels, find the talking potato, listen to her rant about birds, leave the oversized cellar, discover that the British robot made Frankencubes, test, test, test, confront the British robot, put a portal on the moon, get saved by the potato, (wait, what?) listen to some singing guns, and walk out of a shack into a wheat field.
What are you waiting for?
The Aperture Science Handheld Portal Device awaits!

10/10
Tout simplement super !

Portal 2, the sequel to Portal, the popular game its popularity could be expected by no one, even by Valve itself
Turn the head of the player upside down by simple, but complex puzzle
Fun elements to interact with
Memorable characters
Genius level designs
Mysterious story
Awesome workshop stuffs (This one is thanks to the community though)
Plot twists so good it flows perfectly with the game
Ending that is so great, I slow clap the first time I watched it

Rant aside, yeah, this is another "Game of the Decade" by Valve
Graphics are great, maybe magical, to run smoothly while mantaining a great level of detail
The story is mysterious, never told directly, but lots of hints and stuff you may found while wandering around
Sound are kinda, well, normal. But the voice acting are Grade-A, it just really make the world believeable
The gameplay? Portal here, portal there, you move through it. That's it
The level design? Fun. Really, it's the best part of the game

Haven't played the coop though, no friend to play

You really should just buy and play the game, it's really worth it
And if you maybe feel bored along the journey, mark my words, the ending will be worth it. Every single penny, every single second
Gra świetna do kooperacji. Zabawa przy niej naprawdę przednia. Gorąco polecam
One of the best games ive ever played, very good.

U SHOOT PORTAL S ARE THINGS 10/10 +GABEN MADE IT

First time playing; beat it in 2 days. Very addictive, fun, interactive, amazing story, great graphics, you get a sense that you are the main character in the game. The problems are tough and can get you stuck for some time depending on how creative of a thinker you are. Multiplayer is very tough and fun.

Buying this alone, doesn't do the lore justice, I suggest that if you buy this game, you also buy the original Portal too.
If you don't like to be confused, leave, now. This game will throw so many curveballs at you to the point where you aren't quite sure what might kill you. I know a guy who said the game was horrible, because it was "too boring and confusing", (He probably couldn't beat the first part) I however, agree it's confusing, but it's always exciting, as maybe bullets fly around you as you run, or lasers make a criss-cross death trap, or maybe deadly goo will make "the floor is lava" a true saying. You WILL need to think outside the box to get through, you have to get so far outside the box, it may be a distant memory what "the box" was. Thought provoking chambers along with community maps always gives you something to do. Portal 2 is a must-buy for all action, puzzle, first-person fans. It truly is amazing.
10 Порталів із 10 порталів іще 10 гелів і картоплі ГЛАДОС

El genial Portal era tan sólo la antesala a Portal 2. Lo que empezó como un complemento en un pack de Half-Life acabó sobrepasando sus propias expectativas presentando una trama cinematográfica digna de alfombra roja. Algo de tal calibre necesitaba un juego propio y ése es Portal 2.

Con un argumento intrigante y emocionante, unos personajes memorables, un baile de emociones entre la risa y el suspense, unos giros de guión inesperados y un final épico, se nos olvidará que lo que tenemos entre manos es un juego de puzles, si es que no estamos simplemente disfrutando de las vistas de unos escenarios cuidados al detalle y con unos gráficos muy buenos por los que no parece pasar el tiempo.

No podrás parar de jugar hasta terminarlo disfrutando cada una de las situaciones, momentos y diálogos. Querrás la banda sonora, el merchandising y una torreta en tu casa que te diga "¿Podrías acercarte un poco?".

Hilariously fun puzzle game, with a very fun co-operative play feature, with a very nice somewhat hidden background of lore to the characters in the game. Well thought out and easy to get into, I let my young cousins onto my computer to play this game for a little and they were instantly hooked, very PG, so you can trust letting little kids play and they'll be challenged.

Love First-Person Shooters but prefer a night without blood, (al)gore, crude humor? This is it. The puzzles/levels are a jaw dropping, mind numbingly awesome experience. The graphics are still great after all these years, and the framerate is so smooth only Valve could pull this off. The dialog is superb and humor is tasteful as well. I have yet to play co-op because I have like no RL friends at this point in my life (30) and I'm not married with children. It's gotta be awesome, can't wait to try it after I beat single player. I bought this on sale at $4.99 but even if it wasn't on sale, in hindsight I would have bought it at full price. If you can wait for a sale, do it. If not, buy it anyway and send me a friend request!! :-P

现在写评测确实有些晚了，虽然这游戏刚出的时候我就有玩，但一直没通关，这次终于有时间静下心来一口气通了这款神作。V社的游戏确实有一种魔力，虽然少，但是每一款游戏都包含着大量的创意让人不得不感叹制作组的强大与用心。游戏角色虽少，但却不会让人感觉无聊，诙谐的对话让人不时一笑。谜题设置由浅入深，每一个关卡都很有趣而又不会让人摸不着头脑。可惜目前我的网速实在太慢 无法实现合作模式，遗憾。 10分神作!

while the original concept and stories of the first Portal game are expanded in this new instalment, I cannot but feel that this is just a money grab. Sure there is still some good puzzle design, and some funny lines throughout - but the magic is a bit forced. Portal 1 offers I believe a more honest and enjoyable experience than this one - and better in jokes.  8/10
최고의 게임!!!

Portal 2, along with its predecessor, are easily two of my favorite video games of all time. Combining an enthralling storyline with interesting gameplay elements, Portal 2 takes the *ahem* cake when it comes to modern video games. The characters are amazing, with stellar voice acting, quirky humor, and hilarious interactions. The gameplay is superb, relying on completely unique components such as momentum-preserving portals, gels with different properties, and lasers-- among other things. By the end, you'll be willing to pay Valve money to make a threequel. This game is perfect. Why do you think my profile picture is the Portal turret? 110/10
